description.value: B.1 - EHDS refined base model for Patient Summary body data elements

definition.value: B.1 - EHDS refined base model for Patient Summary body data elements
Alert section includes information about allergies, intolerances and other substantial alerts or warnings that health professionals should be aware of.
A record of allergies and intolerances.
Medical alert information (other alerts not included in allergies).
Medical history section.
Vaccination / prophylaxis information.
Resolved, closed or inactive problems.
Medical history section.

This section may provide both synthetic anamnesis (e.g. description of phases of the pathology as a chronological summary of clustered clinical information) and anecdotal evidence that clinicians can collect from the patient, and can read in a narrative form.See Section 2, Chapter III, Art 7, (c).
Medical problems section.
Health conditions affecting the health of the patient and are important to be known for a health professional during a health encounter.
Medical devices and implants section.
Major procedures.
Need for the patient to be continuously assessed by third parties; functional status may influence decisions about how to plan and administer treatments.
Medication summary section.

short.value: B.1.4.1 - Current and relevant past medicines

definition.value: Relevant prescribed medicines whose period of time indicated for the treatment has not yet expired whether it has been dispensed or not, or medicines that influence current health status or are relevant to a clinical decision.
Social history section.
Textual description of the socialhistory.

short.value: B.1.5.2 - Social history observations related to health

definition.value: Health related lifestyle factors or lifestyle observations and social determinants of health. Example: cigarette smoker, alcohol consumption
Clinically relevant time or time period for the observation.
Code representing the observation using the agreed code systems.
Full name of the observation according to the used test coding standard.
Original (conventional) name of the observation
Observation method (measurement principle) to obtain the result.
Device (e.g. analyser) that generates the measurements
Identifies order and order placer this observation belongs to.
Identifies the originator/author and provides provenance information about the source of the results data that may have not originated with the source of the whole Laboratory Report document.
With certain observation results, e.g. there may also be an interpreter or a person responsible for validation.

Result of the observation including text, numeric and coded results of the measurement and measurement uncertainty. Content of the observation result will vary according to the type of the observation.
string text result
A numeric value or interval (open or closed) of the result, result units of the measurement should be provided Measurement uncertainty interval are provided if needed.
A numeric value or interval (open or closed) of the result
Result units of the measurement
Measurement uncertainty type and interval should be provided if needed.

A coded result from a selected coding system(s). This could be a code describing bacteria or other microorganism identified, description of urinary concernment, code explaining technical reason why the test could not be done etc.

description.value: SNOMED CT (for ordinal or nominal scale results and result interpretation)UCUM (for units)

definition.value: Provides a reason why the expected value in the element Observation.value[x] is missing.

Reference range, multiple reference ranges of different types culd by providedProvides guide for interpretation of result. Reference ranges are usually implied only for a numeric scale type. Use of the same units for reference range and value is implied.
Information about reference intervals and result interpretation.
Identifies the observation(s) that triggered the performance of this observation.
This observation is a group observation (e.g. a battery, a panel of tests, a set of vital sign measurements) that includes the target as a member of the group.
Comments and string representation of the observation result and findings.
Anatomic location and laterality where the observation should be or was performed.
The patient, or group of patients, location, device, organization, procedure or practitioner this observation is about.
Example: from 1974 to 2004
Pregnancy history section
Current pregnancy status section
Date on which the observation of the pregnancy state was made
Provides the woman's current state at the date the observation was made: e.g. pregnant, not pregnant, unknown
Date on which the woman is due to give birth.
History of previous pregnancies section
Information on the woman's previous pregnancies:Yes, previous pregnancies; No, previous pregnancies; Unknown
Details of the previous pregnancies
Date referred to the previous pregnancies outcome
Outcome of the previous pregnancies
Number of children/fetus in this specific pregnancy
Patient provided data section
Visited country
Country code
Date of entry and departure
Advance directive section
Existence of documentation on living will
Results section
Observation results pertaining to the subject of care's health condition and which might have impact on future treatments
Therapeutic recommendations that do not include pharmacologic treatments, such as diet, physical exercise, planned surgeries

Narrative containing the plan including proposals, goals, and order requests for monitoring, tracking, or improving the condition of the patient.In the future it is expected that this Section could be provided in a structured and coded format.
Describes the intention of how one or more practitioners intend to deliver care for a particular patient for a period of time, possibly limited to care for a specific condition or set of conditions.
